name: Flooded Crossing
description: A ruined road ends in a waterlogged field. What used to be a shallow ford is now a wide, sluggish river. Stranded wagons, frayed ropes, and anxious traders dot the shoreline.

story_actions.story_text: Inspect the remains of the broken bridge.
You find a woman sitting on a silk-wrapped crate, trying to shield it from the drizzle. She looks up. 'The noble’s name is Seralis. If the silks don’t arrive... they’ll think we failed them. Again.'
A grizzled woman stands beside a half-open crate of armor pieces. 'Iron, leather, steel — and not a buyer in sight. If that bridge stays broken, I start selling to fish.'

You overhear two siblings arguing by a tilted cart. 'You rushed the load!' — 'And you packed it wrong!' Their crates leak flour and tension.

Joryn scowls. 'If this goes bad, the whole village fasts for winter.' Vel snaps, 'Then maybe don’t put your trust in roads.'
Mirella eyes you warily. 'The bridge is more than wood. It’s memory. But if you want to help, start by clearing the wreckage.'
Drag broken beams from the water. Mirella marks salvageable pieces with chalk. The weight is heavier than it should be.
Scavenge wood and nails from abandoned wagons. Mirella glances over occasionally, pointing out what’s still usable.
You pile the last beam aside. Mirella nods. 'It’s worse than I thought. If we’re rebuilding, we’ll need stronger materials — and help from beyond this swamp.'
Mirella kneels and runs her fingers along the old supports. 'If we’re doing this right, I’ll need knotroot timber, stone dowels, and solid braces. Scavenge if you must — or trade. I’ll wait.'
You set the knotted timber down near the ruins. Mirella runs her hand along one piece. 'Grove-grown? Resilient stuff. That’s a good start.'
The carved dowels thud onto the ground. Mirella squints at them. 'Ancient joins… clever. We’ll carve the old into the new.'
You deliver the scavenged planks and nails. Mirella checks their weight and grain. 'We’ll reinforce the seams with these. Should keep the frame steady.'
You lay the braces beside the planks. Mirella picks one up, testing its weight and shape. 'Solid. These will anchor the weight just fine.'
Mirella inspects each material in silence, then finally says, 'This might hold.'
Hammer, lift, set, repeat. Mirella works beside you. The sound of progress cuts through the murk like a hymn.
Mirella places the final beam. Her hands tremble, but not from the weight. 'It’s done. We’ve stitched the land back together. Cross it, if you’re ready.'

You trace the path of the flood with your eyes. Trees half-drowned. Soil turned to silt. A child's toy drifting near a ruined cart.

You imagine rerouting the current — changing its course — but your thoughts feel small against the weight of water.

Maybe... in another life.
A boy named Talen tugs your sleeve. 'There’s a place the water doesn’t touch. Behind the willows. I go there when the yelling starts.'
You scout the willow path. It’s passable — just barely. But a ripple moves across the surface. Something waits beneath.
The reeds part — a massive serpent lunges from the water, all sinew and fangs. You barely have time to react.
You find Talen watching the river. He doesn’t look at you, but speaks. 'You took it, didn’t you? The dry way. I used to go there with my brother… before the water came.'
